Description: Textile fragment; approximately square fragment of linen, medium-coarse quality, undyed but now light tan coloured with greyish (oily ?) stain. Edges torn or cut. Very worn; the extend of wear suggests its former use as a garment. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.21 ends per 10mm and weft c.9 picks per 10mm.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville
Acquisition notes: Wrapped, together with EA 75993 and 75995-75996, in paper labelled in 19th century hand, 'Mummy Clothes various (No. 2)' and in pencil, 'Granville'. Probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by A B Granville in 1821.
